marriages.description: Sarah was Abraham's half-sister (same father, different mothers)
marriages.notes: Abraham said, 'She is indeed my sister, the daughter of my father though not of my mother; and she became my wife.'

marriages.description: Jochebed was Amram's aunt (his father's sister)
marriages.notes: Amram married his father's sister Jochebed, and she bore him Aaron and Moses

marriages.description: Leah was Jacob's first cousin (daughter of his mother's brother)
marriages.notes: Laban had two daughters: Leah and Rachel. Jacob married both sisters.

marriages.description: Rachel was Jacob's first cousin (daughter of his mother's brother)
marriages.notes: Jacob loved Rachel and agreed to work seven years for her hand in marriage

marriages.description: Milcah was Nahor's niece (his brother Haran's daughter)
marriages.notes: Nahor married Milcah, the daughter of Haran his brother

marriages.description: Rebekah was Isaac's first cousin once removed (granddaughter of his father's brother)
marriages.notes: Rebekah was the daughter of Bethuel, son of Nahor, Abraham's brother

marriages.description: Mahalath was Esau's first cousin (daughter of his father's half-brother Ishmael)
marriages.notes: Esau went to Ishmael and took Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael to be his wife

marriages.description: Achsah was Othniel's niece (daughter of his brother Caleb)
marriages.notes: Caleb said, 'He who attacks and captures Kiriath Sepher, I will give him Achsah my daughter as wife.' Othniel son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother, took it

marriages.description: The five daughters of Zelophehad married their father's brothers' sons
marriages.notes: Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah and Noah married their cousins on their father's side to keep the inheritance within the tribe
